page.title: 07THE CHURCHYARD - HURSTBOURNE
page.content: The{Lych Gate} looks old, but was made locally in 1951.Near it, under a large yew tree by the path, is a big tombstone lying horizontally. It is in memory of{Mr James Blount}who died in 1864. In his will Mr Blount asked that a stone big enough for boys to play marbles on, and flat like a table, should be placed in the churchyard in his memory. Unfortunately his tombstone was covered in carvings and is unsuitable for marble playing. There is another stone under the lamp by the church door, which is smaller but flat and plain. It does not seem to be a tombstone. Some parishoners think this is the stone mentioned in Mr Blount's will,others think that this stone was suggested as a substitute by those opposed to children playing on a tombstone.
